## Análises estatísticas


::: {.cell hash='script_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-5_ade370e42bf51f21df6e3e71d67ad686'}
::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
Anova Table (Type II tests)

Response: cot
          Sum Sq  Df  F value Pr(>F)    
trat        33.6   5   0.4820 0.7892    
dias      7927.7   1 568.3329 <2e-16 ***
rep          1.7   1   0.1199 0.7297    
trat:dias    3.0   5   0.0436 0.9989    
Residuals 1827.3 131                    
---
Signif. codes:  0 '***' 0.001 '**' 0.01 '*' 0.05 '.' 0.1 ' ' 1
```
:::
:::


Regressão linear simples utilizando a função lm()

Tem-se uma variável quantitativa independente, dias, e uma dependente, cotilédones.


::: {.cell hash='script_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-6_d35424b7396fa1fe9747fc6753ad7de3'}
::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```

Call:
lm(formula = cot ~ dias, data = cot)

Residuals:
    Min      1Q  Median      3Q     Max 
-10.649  -2.841  -1.575   1.596   7.255 

Coefficients:
            Estimate Std. Error t value Pr(>|t|)    
(Intercept)  32.5534     0.8074   40.32   <2e-16 ***
dias         -1.4149     0.0576  -24.56   <2e-16 ***
---
Signif. codes:  0 '***' 0.001 '**' 0.01 '*' 0.05 '.' 0.1 ' ' 1

Residual standard error: 3.625 on 142 degrees of freedom
Multiple R-squared:  0.8095,	Adjusted R-squared:  0.8082 
F-statistic: 603.4 on 1 and 142 DF,  p-value: < 2.2e-16
```
:::
:::


Gráfico do modelo de regressão polinomial de segunda ordem a ser ajustado (quadrático)


::: {.cell hash='script_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-7_a5252721be8ede03187deb61221fe0c4'}
::: {.cell-output-display}
![](script_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-7-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::


Ajustar modelo


::: {.cell hash='script_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-8_b358a35096a180a5e0ce86cda1a4e5ab'}
::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```

Call:
lm(formula = cot ~ dias + dias2, data = cot)

Residuals:
    Min      1Q  Median      3Q     Max 
-7.1019 -0.2651 -0.1051  0.8981  2.8333 

Coefficients:
             Estimate Std. Error t value Pr(>|t|)    
(Intercept)  6.070650   1.158478    5.24 5.73e-07 ***
dias         2.930634   0.182549   16.05  < 2e-16 ***
dias2       -0.152718   0.006352  -24.04  < 2e-16 ***
---
Signif. codes:  0 '***' 0.001 '**' 0.01 '*' 0.05 '.' 0.1 ' ' 1

Residual standard error: 1.611 on 141 degrees of freedom
Multiple R-squared:  0.9626,	Adjusted R-squared:  0.9621 
F-statistic:  1817 on 2 and 141 DF,  p-value: < 2.2e-16
```
:::
:::

::: {.cell hash='script_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-9_cd415e3870a835d136a2cb1266bd61bc'}
::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
   df      AIC
m1  3 783.5175
m2  4 550.9208
```
:::
:::

# Variável produtividade

## Análise exploratória dos dados

###Importar dados


::: {.cell hash='script_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-11_58b742b38d9965cadfbe348ee8f6933a'}

:::


###Histograma para visualizar a distribuição dos dados.


::: {.cell hash='script_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-12_629909f39f068bd5c3c2012232d377cf'}
::: {.cell-output-display}
![](script_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-12-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::


###Boxplot para visualizar a distribuição do número de cotilédones por tratamento


::: {.cell hash='script_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-13_2706675a4fff0155933c6097cc6f28a1'}

```{.r .cell-code}
prod|> 
  ggplot(aes(trat, prod)) +
  geom_boxplot()+
  labs(x = "Tratamentos", y = "Produtividade (kg/ha)")
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](script_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-13-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::


## Análises estatísticas

###Ajustar o modelo usando aov() DBC


::: {.cell hash='script_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-14_96d2eeb865933ee257bb8d013d37f08f'}

```{.r .cell-code}
aov1 <- aov(prod ~ trat + as.factor(rep), data = prod)
summary(aov1)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
               Df  Sum Sq Mean Sq F value   Pr(>F)    
trat            5 1474239  294848    3.11   0.0256 *  
as.factor(rep)  5 6466891 1293378   13.64 1.79e-06 ***
Residuals      25 2369923   94797                     
---
Signif. codes:  0 '***' 0.001 '**' 0.01 '*' 0.05 '.' 0.1 ' ' 1
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
#Resultado: há efeito de tratamento.
```
:::


###Testar as premissas


::: {.cell hash='script_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-15_beed7b78e6822fcecf7261ed6df7ce58'}

```{.r .cell-code}
#Checar as premissas para verificar se o modelo está correto
library(performance)
check_heteroscedasticity(aov1)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
OK: Error variance appears to be homoscedastic (p = 0.563).
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
check_normality(aov1)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
Warning: Non-normality of residuals detected (p = 0.018).
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
#Resultado: dados homocedásticos mas apresentam normalidade.

library(DHARMa)
plot(simulateResiduals(aov1)) #normalidade a direita e variância homogênea a esquerda
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](script_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-15-1.png){width=672}
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
hist(aov1$residuals)
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](script_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-15-2.png){width=672}
:::
:::


###Gráfico QQ (quantile-quantile)


::: {.cell hash='script_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-16_cff6224b6d579473bf3a77a3e08874b9'}

```{.r .cell-code}
qqnorm(aov1$residuals)
qqline(aov1$residuals)
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](script_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-16-1.png){width=672}
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
#O gráfico QQ (quantile-quantile) é uma ferramenta útil para avaliar a normalidade dos resíduos de um modelo. Se os resíduos seguirem uma distribuição normal, os pontos no gráfico devem se aproximar de uma linha reta. A linha de referência adicionada com qqline() é uma reta que representa a distribuição normal esperada.
```
:::


###Análise de médias estimadas a partir do modelo ajustado


::: {.cell hash='script_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-17_4808b93841b62d727f02660326cd5161'}

```{.r .cell-code}
library(emmeans)
aov1_means <- emmeans(aov1, ~ trat)
aov1_means
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
 trat          emmean  SE df lower.CL upper.CL
 certeza_n       2808 126 25     2549     3067
 ctrl_inoc       2236 126 25     1977     2495
 ctrl_not_inoc   2272 126 25     2013     2531
 derosal_plus    2232 126 25     1973     2491
 maxim_xl        2307 126 25     2049     2566
 quality         2433 126 25     2174     2692

Results are averaged over the levels of: rep 
Confidence level used: 0.95 
```
:::
:::


###Teste de Tukey


::: {.cell hash='script_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-18_c70da3519210a4ba0b6ebba094c11814'}

```{.r .cell-code}
pwpm(aov1_means)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
              certeza_n ctrl_inoc ctrl_not_inoc derosal_plus maxim_xl quality
certeza_n        [2808]    0.0371        0.0575       0.0351   0.0875  0.3151
ctrl_inoc        571.85    [2236]        0.9999       1.0000   0.9985  0.8733
ctrl_not_inoc    536.30    -35.56        [2272]       0.9999   0.9999  0.9407
derosal_plus     576.30      4.44         40.00       [2232]   0.9980  0.8628
maxim_xl         500.74    -71.11        -35.56       -75.56   [2307]  0.9792
quality          374.81   -197.04       -161.48      -201.48  -125.93  [2433]

Row and column labels: trat
Upper triangle: P values   adjust = "tukey"
Diagonal: [Estimates] (emmean) 
Lower triangle: Comparisons (estimate)   earlier vs. later
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
library(multcomp)
library(multcompView)
cld(aov1_means)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
 trat          emmean  SE df lower.CL upper.CL .group
 derosal_plus    2232 126 25     1973     2491  1    
 ctrl_inoc       2236 126 25     1977     2495  1    
 ctrl_not_inoc   2272 126 25     2013     2531  12   
 maxim_xl        2307 126 25     2049     2566  12   
 quality         2433 126 25     2174     2692  12   
 certeza_n       2808 126 25     2549     3067   2   

Results are averaged over the levels of: rep 
Confidence level used: 0.95 
P value adjustment: tukey method for comparing a family of 6 estimates 
significance level used: alpha = 0.05 
NOTE: If two or more means share the same grouping symbol,
      then we cannot show them to be different.
      But we also did not show them to be the same. 
```
:::
:::


# Variável emergência

## Análise exploratória dos dados

###Importar dados


::: {.cell hash='script_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-19_ee592abad0dbb70ad32f79ceccf3a21d'}

:::

###Histograma para visualizar a distribuição dos dados.


::: {.cell hash='script_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-20_2d631ab64ced13e9ef8810bebf7a3620'}
::: {.cell-output-display}
![](script_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-20-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::


###Boxplot para visualizar a distribuição do número de cotilédones por tratamento


::: {.cell hash='script_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-21_4c278f8e0411d13be8302b380374ca66'}

```{.r .cell-code}
emerg|> 
  ggplot(aes(trat, emerg)) +
  geom_boxplot()+
  scale_y_continuous(breaks = seq(0,90,10))+
  labs(x = "Tratamentos", y = "Plantas emergidas")
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](script_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-21-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::


###Número de plantas emergidas ao longo do tempo


::: {.cell hash='script_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-22_e2c53728383f6a9ade19e2e7f09fe397'}
::: {.cell-output-display}
![](script_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-22-1.png){width=672}
:::

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](script_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-22-2.png){width=672}
:::
:::


### Índice de velocidade de emergência


::: {.cell hash='script_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-23_d45da4e0948e74b52d725525a9a371c4'}

```{.r .cell-code}
# Função para calcular o IVE para um tratamento específico
calcular_IVE <- function(emerg, dias) {
  n <- length(emerg)
  IVE <- emerg[1] / dias[1]
  for (i in 2:n) {
    IVE <- IVE + ((emerg[i] - emerg[i-1]) / dias[i])
  }
  return(IVE)
}

# Cálculo do IVE para cada tratamento
resultados <- aggregate(emerg$emerg, by = list(emerg$trat), FUN = calcular_IVE, dias = emerg$dias)

# Criação do dataframe com os resultados do IVE por tratamento
resultado_final <- data.frame(trat = resultados[, 1], IVE = resultados[, 2])
print(resultado_final)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
           trat       IVE
1     certeza_n 11.080952
2     ctrl_inoc 10.528571
3 ctrl_not_inoc 11.519048
4  derosal_plus  9.052381
5      maxim_xl 11.352381
6       quality  9.838095
```
:::
:::

## Análise dos dados

###Ajustar o modelo usando aov() DBC


::: {.cell hash='script_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-24_c59ab74b50e6896a8f52bda17fb112a0'}
::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
Anova Table (Type II tests)

Response: emerg
            Sum Sq  Df  F value  Pr(>F)    
trat          3905   5   2.4452 0.03543 *  
dias        106209   1 332.5489 < 2e-16 ***
factor(rep)    650   5   0.4068 0.84377    
trat:dias      268   5   0.1675 0.97427    
Residuals    63556 199                     
---
Signif. codes:  0 '***' 0.001 '**' 0.01 '*' 0.05 '.' 0.1 ' ' 1
```
:::
:::


####Ajustar o modelo aov() DBC para tratamento e dias


::: {.cell hash='script_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-25_ef53880771ab9c27d8d1c4fb68e6a86c'}

```{.r .cell-code}
trat_emerg = lm(emerg ~ trat + factor(rep), data = emerg)
car::Anova(trat_emerg) #Resultado: não teve efeito de tratamento.
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
Anova Table (Type II tests)

Response: emerg
            Sum Sq  Df F value Pr(>F)
trat          3905   5  0.9415 0.4551
factor(rep)    650   5  0.1566 0.9778
Residuals   170033 205               
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
dias_emerg = lm(emerg ~ dias + factor(rep), data = emerg)
car::Anova(dias_emerg) #Resultado: não teve efeito de dias.
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
Anova Table (Type II tests)

Response: emerg
```
